title: Bar magnet lowered through loop at constant speed

content.question: A bar magnet is lowered at constant speed through a loop of wire as shown in the diagram above. The time at which the midpoint of the bar magnet passes through the loop is t1. Which of the following graphs best represents the time dependence of the induced current in the loop? (A positive current represents a counterclockwise current in the loop as viewed from above.)

choices.label: Option A shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one.  The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends gradually up and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It reaches a maximum at the first tick mark. The curve then extends gradually down and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It reaches a minimum on the horizontal axis at the tick mark labeled t sub one. The pattern is repeated between the second and fourth tick marks.

Option B shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one. The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends gradually up and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It reaches a maximum between the first and second tick marks. The curve then extends steeply down and to the right with first an increasing slope and then as a straight line through the tick mark labeled t sub one. The slope then decreases and the curve reaches a minimum below the horizontal axis, halfway between the second and third tick marks. The curve then extends up and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It levels at the horizontal axis near the fourth tick mark.

Option C shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one. The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends gradually up and to the right with an increasing slope. The curve reaches a maximum above the third tick titled t sub 1 then decreases gradually. It levels the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

Option D shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one. The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends steeply down and to the right with first a decreasing slope and then an increasing slope and then as a straight line through the tick mark labeled t sub one. The slope then increases and the curve reaches a maximum above the horizontal axis, halfway between the second and third tick marks. The curve then extends down and to the right with a decreasing slope. It levels the horizontal axis at the fourth tick mark.

Option E shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one. The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends steeply down and to the right with first a decreasing slope and then an increasing slope. It reaches a minimum at the first tick mark. The curve then extends gradually down and to the right with first an decreasing slope and then an increasing slope. The pattern is repeated between the second and fourth tick marks.

content.answer: Option B shows a graph in the first and fourth quadrants. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled I. There are 4 evenly spaced tick marks along the horizontal axis; the second tick mark is labeled t sub one. The curve begins at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and extends gradually up and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It reaches a maximum between the first and second tick marks. The curve then extends steeply down and to the right with first an increasing slope and then as a straight line through the tick mark labeled t sub one. The slope then decreases and the curve reaches a minimum below the horizontal axis, halfway between the second and third tick marks. The curve then extends up and to the right with first an increasing slope and then a decreasing slope. It levels at the horizontal axis near the fourth tick mark.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
